intro: Conomorpha caracasana, commonly known as the Caracasana tree, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain seeds enclosed in a fleshy, red aril. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
